text: Sajeev Pazhoor (born 8 April 1974) is an Indian novelist, screenwriter, director and government employee from Kerala. ==Personal life== Sajeev Pazhoor worked as a senior sub-editor for Deshabhimani daily. Currently he is working as the Assistant Cultural Officer at Tagore Theatre Thiruvananthapuram for the Department of Information and Public Relations. ==Film career== Sajeev Pazhoor entered the Malayalam film industry in 2013 as the screenwriter of Swapaanam directed by Shaji N. Karun and co-written by Harikrishnan. His short film Chood (Soddem) (2011) got much recognition and critical acclaim. He announced his directorial debut in 2014 with the film titled Ponmuttai, with Indrans and Urvashi in the lead roles. Later news arrived that the project has been postponed. Sajeev Pazhoor then wrote the screenplay for director Dileesh Pothan's Fahadh Faasil-starrer Thondi Muthalum Driksakshiyum (2017).
